subject: Re: [junit] Enhancement Request: Assert.fail(Exception e) could b  e useful.
msgSnippet: ... I found I do pay attention to *where* the problem happens in my tests, not whether it s error or failure.  My tests are from simple to complex, and if a
messageBody:
On Tuesday 20 January 2004 21:32, Stoneham, John G. wrote:
> > Do you /really/ troubleshoot differently based on whether you see F
> > or E?
>
> If I were using a tool to run my tests, which I don't currently but I
> might someday (say, Eclipse, for example), I would most likely want it
> to help me attack failures first; they are occurring under better
> defined circumstances and will likely help to fix the errors I'm seeing
> elsewhere.

I found I do pay attention to *where* the problem happens in my tests, not
whether it's error or failure. My tests are from simple to complex, and
if a test for a simple class fails, many other tests will fail, because
they use that class.

Robert
